Research Teaching Talbot Workshop Travel CV

© 2020. MIT License.


Hi, my name is Yajit Jain. I am a graduate student at Northwestern University working with Prof. John Francis. Previously I was an undergraduate student at MIT.

My research is in manifold topology and homotopy theory.

I am also an organizer of the MIT Talbot Workshop.

Research

My research is in manifold topology and homotopy theory.

Teaching

While in graduate school I have served as a teaching assistant for the following courses. This entails leading weekly discussion sections, holding office hours, and grading homework.

Mentorship

I have mentored several advanced undergraduate students serving as TA’s in the math department.

I founded the Directed Reading Program at Northwestern with Prof. Ezra Getzler and currently serve as an organizer.

Talbot Workshop

I am currently an organizer of the MIT Talbot Workshop alongside Calista Bernard, Morgan Opie, and Lucy Yang.

In 2019 Talbot was held in Brady, TX. The topic was moduli spaces of manifolds, mentored by Prof. Soren Galatius and Prof. Oscar Randal-Williams. We made it into the local newspaper!

Here are the notes for the workshop, originally live TeX-ed by Lucy Yang, and edited by several members of the workshop including myself.

The 2020 workshop, Ambidexterity in Chromatic Homotopy Theory, has been postponed to 2021 and will be held in Nagodoches, TX. It will be mentored by Prof. Jacob Lurie and Prof. Tomer Schlank.
